availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh B. Moore (Green County, Kentucky, farmhand.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Margaret Moore. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from December 31, 1861, to April 7, 1862. Killed at the Battle of Shiloh, Hardin County, Tennessee, on April 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 111A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 556.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0266.
